result.title: Data storage repository
result.description: Secondly, technical data acquisition methods, and data management systems from the vehicle fleet (e.g. energy/fuel consumption, charging time), and infrastructure will be defined. Moreover, surveys for subjective data collection, during or after demonstration phases will be drafted in this task. Finally, both the subjective and objective data will be managed and stored in a cloud-solution provided by V2C2 with special emphasis on security and privacy.This task is responsible for performing comprehensive impact assessment and evaluation from economic, social and environmental perspectives according to the assessment framework (Task 1.2), tools (Task 1.1), and data requirements (Task 1.3, WP4). The performance, feasibility and usability of the introduced services and use cases with respect to the user needs and various city circumstances will be assessed, utilising and analysing the data collected. The potential impacts of the implemented e-mobility solutions will be explored from different perspectives such as: user acceptance, environment, GHG and other emissions, air quality, traffic safety, traffic efficiency, energy efficiency, personal mobility, well-being/quality of life, sustainability, electrical safety. The assessment will both be performed ex-ante and ex-post.

result.title: Baseline and COGNIPLANT demonstrators Life Cycle Inventory (LCI)
result.description: Baseline and COGNIPLANT demonstrators Life Cycle Inventory (LCI) Collect and report all the information required to perform a LCA about the state of the art demonstrators and the upgraded plants where COGNIPLANT solutions are deployed. For each reference unit, both background data will be collected, from LCI databases available in literature, and foreground data, specific of each demonstrator. LCI data are collected according to the boundaries of the analysis that are set. D5.4 also provides a description of the life cycle model developed for each of the case studies.

result.title: Life Cycle Impact Assessment (LCIA).
result.description: Life Cycle Impact Assessment (LCIA). Report the results of the actual LCAs performed on each demonstrator. The outcomes of the analyses will be reported according to the guidelines described in ISO 14040, measuring the impacts listed in the relevant standard. A comparison between the impacts of all case studies (in baseline vs. COGNIPLANT configuration) will be performed, to highlight the main source of environmental impact within each life cycle, and possible future ways of improvement will be proposed.
